channel.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
channel.description:
I've been lurking throw this forums for 2 years now but never registered.
I wanted to make a new play through Half-Life 2 and its episodes and asked myself if there were any mods out there that enhanced its graphics somehow. I mean, theres a clear graphic improvement from HL2 to EP2 and always wondered why valve didn't updated HL2 to make it look like EP2.
Well, if you know any mods or addons that fits into my description it would be nice for you to mention them :smiley: .
PD : Damn it, my first thread and I am already misspelling (see thread's name) D:

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: Hazzmat
item.description:
Siggs:

I think I’ll bump incase Hazzmat hasn’t seen it yet. Also, could be useful for other people.
.

Thanks mate I’ll check it out.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
Siggs:

I’m uploading some files now, because it’s easier than rolling all around FPSbanana to find what I want

Step 1. Install HL2-Update. Should turn up in the sourcemods folder.

Step 2. Install the Fakefactory outdoors addon into the HLupdate files. NOT NORMAL HL2

Step 3. Install the 2.12 Fakefactory the same way.

Step 4. Downloadmy pack from here.

Step 5. Install the HD citadel and HD arms in my pack. Doesn’t matter which first.

Step 6. Install VertThrashers Weapons pack. THEN install the e3_AR2 afterwards, so it overwrites the one in thrashers pack. (This is personal preference, I like this AR2, the combine assault rifle, more than thrashers. He changed the colour scheme on his)

voila!

p.s. This is my personal preference btw, you may not think the same.

Thanks!! I will start downloading this later and see if its what I’m looking for.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?

item.description:
I’m uploading some files now, because it’s easier than rolling all around FPSbanana to find what I want

Step 1. Install HL2-Update. Should turn up in the sourcemods folder.

Step 2. Install the Fakefactory outdoors addon into the HLupdate files. NOT NORMAL HL2

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
James.Curse:

Wait… the light edition replaces the levels and just that?? No new music nor new lighting nor achievements??

No. It updates lighting, textures, particles, and map geometry but not models or music.

Read full topic

item.description:
James.Curse:

Wait… the light edition replaces the levels and just that?? No new music nor new lighting nor achievements??

None of the Cinematic Mods have achievements do they? Or am I misremembering? If you want achievements HL Update is your best bet.

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
James.Curse:

…What I’m looking for is something that improves stuff such as textures, lighting, models, etc. Not new models, levels, sounds, etc, that give the game another feel. Stuff you would expect valve to improve if this was EP3.

You best bet, right now, is still probably the light edition of Cinematic Mod 10 (replace environment maps only). Than you could probably find acceptable HD versions of the character and weapon models from other sites.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
Or just leave the soundtrack and not fuck with anything that’s crucial to immersion.

But yeah, there’s an enb series for Hl2. Adds ambient occlusion and bloom. You can turn the bloom down/ off (as you probably should. Nothings worse than bloom on top of bloom)

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: Scentedwiind
item.description:
I’ve used the cinematic mod 10. Although it improves the lighting and weapon textures, there is not much else to it. If they had spent more time looking at a variety of music rather than the same bland soundtrack it would be vastly improved.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: Deathmonkey7
item.description:
That’s basically what Fake Factory does. They just fail. You could try the light edition. I still haven’t downloaded it but if it just altered the maps then it may be worth it.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: James.Curse
item.description:
Well now I know what you guys where referring with the whole “questionable artistic direction”.

What I’m looking for is something that improves stuff such as textures, lighting, models, etc. Not new models, levels, sounds, etc, that give the game another feel. Stuff you would expect valve to improve if this was EP3.

Read full topic

item.title: ¿Half-Life 2 graphic improvement mods?
item.dc:creator: rorriMAesU
item.description:
Here is already mentioned cinematic mod version 10

I have been using it and prefer it to vanilla HL2 with regards to the environments, weapon models, and gameplay. My biggest gripe however, is with the optional HD character models, but only because some do not possess a “half life feel” or fit the character of the voice acting. The quality of the models is great, but IMO the artistic direction if questionable.

If you are looking for a graphical improvement to HL2, definitely give Cinematic Mod a try.

Read full topic
